comment: Take her! She's clear with her instructions and grading criteria and is happy to help outside of class. There were a couple of times where I couldn't make the deadline and she was really understanding and gave me an extension. Class mostly consists of research with 3 major assignments along with a couple of other group assignments. Easy A
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Post was a great professor. She has very straight forward lessons and is very straight forward on expectations for papers. The class mostly consists of research, and if you need any help she is more than willing to. If you participate, its a great help for ideas on how to formulate your paper. Grade mostly consisted of 3 major writing assignments.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Graded by few things

comment: She is a funny and good teacher. Ask her any question and she'd give you a straight answer! Only you can make this class hard for yourself. I suggest taking 50% online since her lectures are short and we usually leave early but it's still good to meet up with her just in case if you're prone to forgetting things.
Most approachable and understanding teacher at KSU 10/10 so good I'm taking her again this semester
She is amazing! Y'all need to take her. Simple.
Great professor! Take her at any time no matter what, it is worth it.

Professor post is an excellent and easy teacher! I had her for a hybrid class but I only showed up for the first 3-4 classes. There were not a lot of assignments, she asked us to buy a textbook- I never did and was fine without it. She is very chill, and she actually really understands college students- IF SHE IS AN OPTION TAKE HER!!!!

Professor Post is so kind and relates the most random things to what we're learning. She's approachable if you talk to her and understands we are people outside of being a student. There were 3 major essays with some discussion posts that make up the grading.

Professor Post was a great professor and cared about her students. She understands that we have other classes to focus on and gives you extended time to do work if needed. I would recommend going to class to understand what she is asking in her papers, but attendance is not mandatory. Overall, a very easy class.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Caring--Graded by few things

comment: Dr. Post is a great English professor and I highly recommend her hybrid class if you're comfortable working independently. It is a true shame that more people don't attend her lectures, as they're definitely helpful. She is easily reachable outside of class, either via email or text and she definitely helped improve my writing skills.
She was the best professor I had both semesters of my freshman year. She's very understanding and lenient.
By far one of the best professors I've ever had. She is very flexible and understands that students have a lot going on, so she is very lenient.

Best teacher ever. She is very lenient with deadlines as long as you communicate with her. It is a good bit of writing and research but she divides it up well so it's not overwhelming. I got to exempt the final paper for turning in everything on time and have an A in the class. She is super chill and easy to listen to. Definitely recommend taking !
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Graded by few things

comment: Her ENGL1102 class is basically defined by how much writing and reading you'll have to do in it. That being said, Prof. Post herself is very lenient when it comes to due dates (especially if you tell her beforehand). I'd recommend her to anyone, but I'd also remind them that even if she's a very lenient and caring professor, there is a LOT of work.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Caring--So many papers

comment: Professor Post is awesome. She gives great feedback and suggestions on how to write papers during writing conferences. You will write a decent amount of papers in her class but she basically tells you how to write them. She is very chill and understanding. Definetly a great professor! I took her class as a hybrid, would take her again!

Post is super caring, funny, and wants to help you. She is very understanding of an individuals personal situation, and although it says in her syllabus that she doesnt take late work if you talk to her she likely will. The entire class is made up of essays, yet you choose your topic. The class is not a burden, and is easy to pass if you try.

Fun and caring professor. Cancelled class a lot. I didn't try at all and I missed a quiz because I was out of town and because she cancelled basically half the semester I had a low quiz average because the other quizzes were cancelled. I ended with a C but I feel like I deserved it even if it ruined my GPA. Still a great professor.

this class is really easy, shes a student so she gets the struggle. precis are pretty simple and you get to pick your own topic to write on. papers are easy and she gives helpful feedback. not a lot of work so her deadlines are pretty final. easy A class and you actually learn. classes are scheduled for 1hr and 15min but she wraps up in 30min

Professor Post really understands college students and makes her classes funny and straightforward. She really cares if you do well. For most papers, she tells you exactly what you need to fix before turning in the final copy.

Professor Post cares about her students and truly wants them to succeed. If you go to class and do the work, you will do well in this course. If you are struggling, she will work with you and try to do whatever it takes to improve your grade.

She is a good lecturer, but when it comes to grading she is a tough grader. I worked really hard in this class, and instead of actually giving me feedback to improve my writing she just deducted a lot of points. I was disappointed.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: I took her hybrid class and she would maybe keep you in there for max 30 min per class which is amazing. Be ready to write a ton of papers, she's lenient on deadlines but slightly  tougher when it comes to grading. Prob wrote about 20 papers, which was a lot. She's very opinionated, kinda inappropriate and a little strange.

Do good on the papers you make an A. Easy class, usually got out of class after 30 minutes. I took the hybrid course which is easy. If you don't  take her you're an idiot, you pick a theme for the semester and all your papers are about that theme. Quizzes from book are pointless but they're not too hard easy A if you are good at writing papers

Take her! She isn't a hard grader. I took this as a hybrid, so there were discussion board posts for the text and peer reviews needed to be posted. Online chapter quizzes are easy. 4 essays total, they get longer each time but it's manageable. Class is straight to the point & it's usually done 20 minutes before.

Professor Post, is the best. I've haven't had a better teacher yet and I don't think anyone can compete with her. Class is quick and to the point and if we don't have questions we usually leave about 20-30min into the class. We never have HW. Just a few easy quizzes and four papers. If you don't get an A in her class, then well, your DUMB!

Professor Post is awesome. She grades very fairly, and she is super understanding. Her lectures are hilarious. There is a lot of writing, but she structures the assignments to build on one another so it is not difficult or time consuming. Highly recommend!

Great professor! Took the hybrid class, only met once a week. A few papers, which she grades rather fairly. Around 7 quizzes, but they're easy and right out of the book. Usually lets class out early in order for you to ask specific one-on-one questions . Overall easy class, and good professor.

Professor Post was an amazing professor!! You get to pick your research topic for the semester and she is always willing to help you if you need help. Few quizzes throughout the semester. Overall a wonderful class. She loves telling her life stories and letting students out of class super early. Highly recommend!

She is hilarious and fun to talk to! Let's the class go after 15-30 minutes of explaining what she wants us to do. Super relaxed. Very clear on expectations. This class was no big deal and it was an easy A.

Super, super chill. Met once a week & we always got out pretty early. She's not much of a lecturer which was fine with me because I'm already pretty decent at writing, but if you're looking to learn in depth I might go with someone else. If just want a chill teacher and 3 credit hours, take her. Not great at communicating though! Would take again.

I don't think there could be a more chill teacher. She is kind, calm, funny, and knowledgeable. Not difficult. This class is all about writing research papers. Don't buy the books, we never used them. Lectures are short and easy.

Professor Post is the most relate-able Professor I have had thus far. She is as far from boring as you can get! Great Professor that helps you grasp how to start writing higher level papers, and the purpose of doing so. You can only miss a total of 5 classes but that is manageable. I would highly recommend her!

BEST ENGLISH 1101 AND 1102 TEACHER. I hated english in high school. Took her my first semester freshman year, and I absolutely love english now. I am currently taking her once again, but for english 1102 (second semester freshman year), and she is still an amazing Prof. DEFINITELY RECOMMEND TAKING HER.
